body: A magician dabbles in performance, but sees it as a means to tap into universal energies and channel them.
name: Magician

sections.body: A magician gains the following types of bardic performance.

A magician can use performance to manipulate magical energies. Allies of the magician gain a +1 bonus on caster level checks, concentration checks, and attack rolls with spells and spell-like abilities. This bonus increases by +1 at 5th level and every six levels thereafter. This ability relies on visual and audible components. It replaces inspire courage.
sections.name: Dweomercraft
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Bard/Bard Archetypes/Magician/Bardic Performance/Dweomercraft

sections.body: A 8th level, a magician can use performance to counter the spells of his foes. Once the bard begins using this performance, he tracks the number of rounds it has been in use. While performing, as an immediate action, he can attempt to counter any spell that he can identify using Spellcraft, so long as that spell's level is equal or less than the total number of rounds he has been performing spell suppression. The attempt to counter the spell is made as if using dispel magic, using the bard's level as the caster level. If successful, the bardic performance immediately ends. This ability requires audible components. This performance replaces dirge of doom.
sections.name: Spell Suppression
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Bard/Bard Archetypes/Magician/Bardic Performance/Spell Suppression

sections.body: At 14th level, a magician can use performance to apply a metamagic feat to a spell he is about to cast without increasing the casting time. The bard must still expend a higher-level slot to cast this spell. This causes the performance to immediately end. This ability requires audible components. This performance replaces frightening tune.
sections.name: Metamagic Mastery
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Bard/Bard Archetypes/Magician/Bardic Performance/Metamagic Mastery

sections.name: Bardic Performance

sections.body: A magician gains a bonus equal to half his level on Knowledge (arcana), Spellcraft, and Use Magic Device checks. This ability replaces bardic knowledge.
sections.name: Magical Talent
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Bard/Bard Archetypes/Magician/Magical Talent

sections.body: A magician gains Improved Counterspell as a bonus feat. This ability replaces countersong.
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Bard/Bard Archetypes/Magician/Improved Counterspell
sections.name: Improved Counterspell

sections.body: At 2nd level, a magician can extend the duration of bardic performance after he stops concentrating by sacrificing a spell slot as a swift action. The performance effect lingers for 1 extra round per level of the spell. Only one spell may be sacrificed per performance, and performance types that take affect after a specific number of rounds cannot be extended. This ability replaces well-versed.
sections.name: Extended Performance
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Bard/Bard Archetypes/Magician/Extended Performance

sections.body: At 2nd level and every four levels thereafter, a magician can add one spell to his spells known from the spell list of any arcane spellcasting class. The spell must be of a level he can cast. This ability replaces versatile performance.
sections.name: Expanded Repertoire
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Bard/Bard Archetypes/Magician/Expanded Repertoire

sections.body: At 5th level, a magician gains the arcane bond ability as a wizard. He may not choose a familiar or a weapon as a bonded item. This ability replaces lore master.
sections.name: Arcane Bond
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Bard/Bard Archetypes/Magician/Arcane Bond

sections.body: At 10th level, when a magician uses a wand containing a spell on his spell list, he uses his Charisma bonus to set the wand's save DC. At 16th level, when using such a wand, he uses his caster level in place of the wand's caster level. This ability replaces jack of all trades.
sections.name: Wand Mastery
sections.url: pfsrd://Advanced Players Guide/Rules/Core Classes/Bard/Bard Archetypes/Magician/Wand Mastery
